examples: Hailed far and wide as a virtuoso, perhaps the greatest glass artist of the 20th century …

definition: a person who has exceptional skill, expertise, or talent at some endeavor
examples: … instances in which young computer virtuosos occasionally cross the legal boundaries of remote computer systems.

definition: a person interested in the pursuit of knowledge in some specialized field and especially in the arts and sciences
examples: [Samuel] Pepys was a characteristic product of his day, a virtuoso, a man sympathetic to every new trend in science and scholarship.

definition: a person interested in or having a taste for the fine arts
examples: In the eighteenth century, rich "virtuosos" like Richard Payne Knight and his friend Charles Townley assembled vast collections of everything from Roman sculpture to skewered beetles …
